title: After a Chaotic Start, a U.S. Attorney’s Time May Be Running Out
summary: Alina Habba, President Trump’s choice to run the U.S. attorney’s office in New Jersey, has pursued investigations against Democrats. Her tenure has damaged morale inside the office.

title: A Kite Surfer, Navy SEAL and Makeup Artist: Freed in a U.S.-Venezuela Swap
summary: Over 260 people were released from prisons in El Salvador and Venezuela. Now they face the challenge of coming home.

title: Number of Missing in Kerr County, Texas, After Floods Drops to 3
summary: The new figure was a significant decline from 97 just days ago. The death toll in the county remained the same, and officials said many of the missing were reported safe.

title: Heavy Rains in Washington Area Flood Roads and Prompt Water Rescues
summary: More than five inches fell in some suburbs of the capital. The authorities in Maryland rescued dozens of people, including some who were stranded in their cars.

title: Inside the Long Friendship Between Trump and Epstein
summary: For nearly 15 years, the two men socialized together in Manhattan and Palm Beach, Fla., before a falling out that preceded Mr. Epstein’s first arrest.

title: What to Know About the Fallout Around the Epstein Files and the Trump Administration
summary: Here’s what to know about the disturbing facts and unsubstantiated suspicions that make Jeffrey Epstein, a registered sex offender, a politically potent obsession.

title: Popular Podcasts Like Joe Rogan and Theo Von Are All Video Now. Who Is Watching?
summary: An audio-only medium spawned a giant industry that is now largely focused on video.

title: What Would a Real Friendship With A.I. Look Like? Maybe Like Hers.
summary: Chatbots can get scary if you suspend your disbelief. But MJ Cocking didn’t — and wound up in a relationship that was strangely, helpfully real.

title: Israel Issues Evacuation Order for New Area in Gaza
summary: The military told Palestinians to leave an area where many have sought refuge during the 21-month war and warned that it may expand operations.

title: Inside the Reindustrialize Summit and Its Push to Revive U.S. Manufacturing
summary: Trump cabinet officials mingled with tech investors and manufacturers in an effort to supercharge factories.

title: As Trump Courts a More Assertive Beijing, China Hawks Are Losing Out
summary: The Trump administration has dialed back aggressive measures against China and reversed its position on technology controls as the president angles for a Chinese trip later this year.

title: China Exit Ban on Wells Fargo Executive Stokes Foreign Business Anxiety
summary: The case comes around the same time a Japanese pharmaceutical executive was imprisoned, adding to growing unease even as Beijing tries to court overseas investors.

title: Mamdani Won Over N.Y.C. Democratic Voters. Can He Charm Washington?
summary: National Democrats are grappling with how much to embrace Assemblyman Zohran Mamdani, a leftist who has become the party’s standard-bearer in America’s largest city.

title: ​A Trump-Themed Beach House vs. ‘the Hamptons of the South’
summary: Local officials spent years trying to force Marvin Peavy to remove the giant pro-Trump banners from his home in the Florida Panhandle. This summer, Mr. Peavy is basking in victory.

title: Should Food Stamps Pay for Soda?
summary: Colorado and Texas are among the states aiming to change what food and drink can be bought with SNAP benefits.

title: Why American Jews No Longer Understand One Another
summary: The consensus that held them together for generations is breaking down.

title: I Teach Creative Writing. This Is What A.I. Is Doing to Students.
summary: We need to reckon with what ChatGPT is doing to the classroom and to human expression.

title: Investigators in L.A. Explosion Examine Condo for Link to Explosives
summary: Officials were looking into whether the explosion, which killed three sheriff’s deputies, was caused by devices seized from a condo in Santa Monica a day before the blast.

title: The Pelicot Trial Returns, This Time to the Stage
summary: Many of those who attended the trial returned to see a new play based on the case of Gisèle Pelicot, who confronted her ex-husband and dozens of men accused of raping her.

title: The K-Pop Band Big Ocean Is Making Waves With Sign Language
summary: Big Ocean, a boy band whose members are deaf or hard of hearing, has found success with a mix of singing and signing.
